mods.abstract: Page 113 of the album includes three photographs.; Photograph 1 [46] shows a field of cowpeas, W.R. Dodson wearing a derby hat stands in the distance. Buildings and a fence are shown in the background. Photograph location probably the Experiment Station in Baton Rouge.; Photograph 2 [47] shows a field of cowpeas. A man with a hat and neck tie stands center in the distance, tree line visible behind him.; Photograph 3 [48] shows a man driving a horse-drawn harvester. A second man stands waist high in crop vegetation next to the harvester.
mods.note: Photograph of W.R. Dodson (approx. 1916). Retrieved August 4, 2014, from http://www.louisianadigitallibrary.org/cdm/singleitem/collection/LSU_UAP/id/2366/rec/114; Compare Photograph 2 to the following publication. Dodson, W.R. (1910, November) The Best Crops to Grow for Hogs and Other Data. Louisiana Bulletin, No. 124, p. 39. Photograph is captioned, "Cowpeas on experiment station."

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
